revised_title: Effects of Lightning on the Danish Church in Wellclose-Square
tldr: Gustavus Brander reports on the damage caused by lightning to the Danish Church in Wellclose-Square. The lightning struck the church's clock mechanism, melting the wire, chain, and iron bar connecting the clock to the clapper. The author speculates that the lightning may have entered through the exposed wire or through the windows, and discusses the possible effects of thunder on the incident.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Natural Disasters
